title: Func def. by int.: 3 line segments part - c

content.description: The graph of the function f above consists of three line segments.
content.question: Let h be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4464@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find all values of x in the closed interval −4≤x≤3 for which h(x)=0.

frqParts.text: Let h be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4464@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find all values of x in the closed interval −4≤x≤3 for which h(x)=0.

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
